title: Brexit: Is fishing the next big argument in the talks?
description: Fishing looks like being the first big argument of the UK's trade negotiations with the EU.

title: Coronation Street: Why it's more than just a soap
description: As the show's 10,000th episode airs, Radio 1 Newsbeat hears from the show's dedicated fan base.

title: Huawei: Senior Tories want Huawei 'ruled out' of 5G plans
description: They say there are alternatives to the Chinese firm and want Tory MPs to raise their concerns.

title: Harry and Meghan attend JP Morgan event in Miami
description: Prince Harry speaks at the event, a month after the couple announced plans to step back as senior royals.

title: Coronavirus: Five Brits in French ski chalet catch virus
description: The four adults and a child are not in a serious condition, the French health minister says.

title: Police speak to boy sent messages by Derek Mackay
description: The 16-year-old who was sent 270 messages by the former finance secretary speaks to detectives.

title: Sydney Sixers win Big Bash title with victory over Melbourne Stars
description: Sydney Sixers win the 2019-20 Big Bash League title with a 19-run victory over Melbourne Stars in a rain-shortened final at the Sydney Cricket Ground.

title: Rugby star Maro Itoje: Who would he support in Nigeria v England?
description: England's Rugby World Cup finalist, whose parents were born in Nigeria, talks about his identity.

title: Irish general election: Polls open for first-ever Saturday general election vote
description: A total of 160 representatives will be returned to the 33rd Dáil, which will sit on 20 February.

title: Bus driver helps save girl after choking on apple
description: Mark Dawson was widely praised after performing "back blows" to clear the blockage.

title: Ighalo to miss Man Utd training camp over coronavirus risk
description: Manchester United's Odion Ighalo will miss the club's training camp in Spain because of fears the coronavirus outbreak could lead to him being refused entry back into the UK.

title: Newspaper headlines: Support for TV's Phillip Schofield, and cabinet reshuffle 'warning'
description: Many of Saturday's front pages react to the ITV host's decision to publicly come out as gay.

title: Best film nominees in 40 seconds
description: Forty seconds worth of Oscar knowledge, with a peek at the films vying for best picture.

title: Brett Kinloch's bucket list fulfilled by wife in his memory
description: Brett Kinloch, 31, died of a brain tumour just three hours after his daughter Ariya was born.

title: Bishop Treacy's National Railway Museum photos show 'power of steam'
description: The National Railway Museum called the late Eric Treacy one of Britain's best railway photographers.

title: What is the science behind The Goop Lab's claims?
description: Gwyneth Paltrow's exploration of alternative therapies has angered critics, including the NHS.

title: Black Cosplay: Why February is a month of celebration
description: Costume makers are using February to celebrate 29 days of Black Cosplay

title: Should the Oscars rip up the rulebook on the ceremony?
description: Organisers have cultivated a ceremony that's "too long" and "boring" according to some film fans.

title: Imprisoned by cladding: The flat owners who cannot sell
description: Thousands in the UK are living in flats they can't sell, because the outside wall is covered in cladding.

title: Syria war: Forgotten amid the bombs: Idlib's ancient, ruined riches
description: From a giant basalt lion to its own Notre-Dame, Idlib's ancient monuments are in danger.

title: Week in Pictures: 1 - 7 February
description: A selection of striking news photographs from around the world this week.

title: Oscars 2020: What's it like to be a nominee?
description: The BBC's LA correspondent Sophie Long talks to talent from behind and in front of the camera.

title: Sepsis amputation surgeon back at work after losing legs
description: Vascular surgeon Neil Hopper had both of his legs amputated after contracting sepsis.

title: Labour shadow minister Jon Ashworth in 'end of the party' warning
description: Jon Ashworth says Labour could be out of power for 15 years - and Michael Gove defends Tory strategy.

title: Why is there less snow on Scotland's mountains this year?
description: Enthusiasts say they have noticed a difference in conditions on the hills in recent years.
